name: Hotel ZaZa Houston

reviews.text: My daughter is in college in Houston and I stay at the Za frequently and have never been disappointed with anything. The beds are very comfortable, showers and baths great, food is wonderful and the theme rooms are very fun!! The pool is beautiful and the drinks tasty!!!! Check in is always fast and easy! They put a quote and goodie on your bed when they turn down the bed, these are always fun!
reviews.title: Love this place!!!!

reviews.text: You pay a little more for this hotel but it is TOTALLY worth it.
reviews.title: A Business Traveler's Dream...

reviews.text: My job brings me to Houston on a regular basis; 5-8 nights per month on average. I always stay at the Hotel ZaZa, even though it's a courtesy car ride away from downtown. The atmosphere is vibrant and exciting, the rooms are always immaculate, and the personal touches never fail to raise my spirits! Not a mint on the pillow, but a box of Junior Mints instead... I need to give a special nod to Spencer, the Food and Beverage Manager, as someone who welcomes me as both a guest and a friend, and Guideon, who waits on my table at dinner in a way that makes me not want to leave the restaurant! This is a truly special hotel-- give it a try on your next turn through Houston.
reviews.title: Funky, but Tasteful
Trendy and popular, still excellent
reviews.text: Hotel ZaZa is a bit out of the ordinary and I can best describe it as somewhat "funky." It is definitely not the typical cooker-cutter hotel that you find with so many chains. To give you and example, there are two very large zebra-skinned chairs that great you in the lobby. Also, don't be surprised if you see photos of near-naked women decorating the rooms. Don't get me wrong, it is all very classy and tastefully decorated.
Very attentive service and good restaurant.
reviews.title: Nothing special... "SoSo"

reviews.text: I am a regualr visotir to Houston for business and normally stay at the Houstonian or the Four Seasons. I have stayed at the Zaza twice in recent months and wish I had discovered Hotel Zaza sooner.
reviews.title: Why haven't I stayed here before?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms can be bit of a lottery I have had a quirky suite which was nice but a bit dimmly lit and the second time a more standard room.
reviews.title: ZAZA is Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Fantastic Weekend and Wedding!

reviews.text: Friendly staff
reviews.title: Amazing design and location!

reviews.text: Good food
reviews.title: From Warwick to ZaZa

reviews.text: I just finished a 3 night stay here, which I was reasonably satisfied with, but which would have been better had the service not been so inconsistent. The rooms and public areas of the hotel are very nice; style is somewhere between a "W" and a Kimpton, for those familiar with those chains. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean, so the basics were fine.
reviews.title: Nice rooms but service not at the same level

reviews.text: The service, however, was not at the same level. Some examples:
reviews.title: Another Great Stay.....

reviews.text: - Upon arrival at midnight, the desk clerk had no knowledge about the rate booked and took nearly a half hour after I forwarded him confirmation emails to understand what was supposed to be included (even then, some of the benefits were not honored). Meanwhile I was left standing there waiting until after 12:30am.
reviews.title: First class.

reviews.text: - Orders from room service did not arrive in the promised time (order promised for 30 mins took 45+)
reviews.title: Poor customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Calls to valet parking for the car were sometimes ignored -- they had not even pulled the ticket when I got to the front desk, much less tried to bring up the car.
reviews.title: Great location & staff

reviews.text: I stayed at ZAZA for a wedding and from the moment we entered the hotel until we left the next day our stay was fantastic. The hotel is iconic to Houston and now it is just the perfect destination for wonderful memories that last a lifetime.
reviews.title: most fun hotel in Houston

reviews.text: The location is fabulous, the hotel packed with fun and I cannot wait to have another excuse to go to ZAZA!
reviews.title: Good Boutique

reviews.text: Not being keen on boutique hotels, I must say this one stands out. Good hotel, trendy deco, good small gym/spa, friendly staff. Excellent location in the museum district, close to a choice of good restaurants on Montrose. You may have to go the extra buck for a really good room ( a fantastico suite, like us). Jacuzzi-size pool is a minus.
reviews.title: Great Package

reviews.text: ZaZa never disappoints. When calling to make a reservation, the agent informed me about a package being offered that included tickets to the museum and dinner at The Monarch. This made my usual enjoyable stay at the ZaZa even more memorable. I highly recommend when making a reservation, inquire about their packages.
reviews.title: $$$, but worth it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for business. OMG, very nice. Staff and service was GREAT!!! Bed was verrry comfy. Love the Bathroom, was as large as sleeping area. Can't go wrong if you stay here. Nice balcony that over looks the pool.
reviews.title: How a manager saved my stay!!!

description: A luxury hotel including restaurants, pool, fitness center, spa & spa cafe with a pet friendly policy located in downtown Houston. Known for their sophisticated service and modern interior.
